meanings.definition: The quality or state of being interpretable.
meanings.sent1: The interpretabilities of the ancient text made it challenging to decipher.
meanings.sent2: Scientists debated the interpretabilities of the data collected from the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The interpretabilities of the cryptic message left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork had a depth of interpretabilities that captivated the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The interpretabilities of the poem allowed for various personal interpretations.

meanings.definition: The ability to be understood or explained in different ways.
meanings.sent1: The interpretabilities of the concept made it accessible to a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: The novel's plot had many interpretabilities, leading to diverse book club discussions.
meanings.sent3: The interpretabilities of the joke caused laughter from different perspectives.
meanings.sent4: His speech had interpretabilities that resonated with people from various backgrounds.
meanings.sent5: The interpretabilities of the theory sparked intellectual curiosity among students.
